recipe.title: Cloud Bread
recipe.description: Cloud Bread is a low carb, low calorie, keto, gluten free, grain free sandwich bread option for people on special diets. This recipe is so healthy, easy to make, and fun to eat!
recipe.ingredients: 2 ounces cream cheese (, at room temperature), 3 large eggs (, at room temperature), 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
instructions.name: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl with an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese until smooth and creamy.
instructions.name: In a medium bowl with an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese until smooth and creamy.

instructions.text: Separate the eggs and place the yolks in the bowl with the cream cheese, and the egg whites in a different bowl with the cream of tartar and salt.
instructions.name: Separate the eggs and place the yolks in the bowl with the cream cheese, and the egg whites in a different bowl with the cream of tartar and salt.

instructions.text: Beat the cream cheese with the yolks until combined and perfectly smooth.
instructions.name: Beat the cream cheese with the yolks until combined and perfectly smooth.

instructions.text: Wipe off the beaters thoroughly and beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form, about 2-3 minutes.
instructions.name: Wipe off the beaters thoroughly and beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form, about 2-3 minutes.

instructions.text: Very gently fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture, until completely combined, but still fluffy (do not stir or mix or the eggs will deflate.)
instructions.name: Very gently fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture, until completely combined, but still fluffy (do not stir or mix or the eggs will deflate.)

instructions.text: Divide the mixture into 8 mounds (about 1/3 cup each) on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them 4-inches apart.
instructions.name: Divide the mixture into 8 mounds (about 1/3 cup each) on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them 4-inches apart.

instructions.text: Bake until golden, 25-30 minutes.
instructions.name: Bake until golden, 25-30 minutes.

instructions.text: Cloud bread is pretty tasteless. Here are a few of my favorite ways to give it more flavor:Pizza Cloud Bread - stir 1 1/2 teaspoons Italian seasoning, 2 tablespoons freshly grated parmesan, and 2 teaspoons tomato paste into the egg yolk mixture.Everything Cloud Bread - stir 1 tablespoon Everything bagel seasoning into the egg yolk mixtureRanch Cloud Bread - stir 1 1/2 teaspoons ranch seasoning mix into the egg yolk mixture.
instructions.name: Cloud bread is pretty tasteless. Here are a few of my favorite ways to give it more flavor:Pizza Cloud Bread - stir 1 1/2 teaspoons Italian seasoning, 2 tablespoons freshly grated parmesan, and 2 teaspoons tomato paste into the egg yolk mixture.Everything Cloud Bread - stir 1 tablespoon Everything bagel seasoning into the egg yolk mixtureRanch Cloud Bread - stir 1 1/2 teaspoons ranch seasoning mix into the egg yolk mixture.

recipe.title: Keto Cloud Bread Sandwich
recipe.description: Easy and fluffy low-carb and keto-friendly bread made with egg and cream cheese.
recipe.ingredients: 4  egg yolks, 4  egg whites, ⅓ cup cream cheese, ½ tsp baking powder (gluten-free ), pinch salt, 1  avocado (sliced), 4 slices bacon (cooked), 4 tsp mayonnaise

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 F.
instructions.name: Preheat the oven to 300 F.

instructions.text: In a bowl beat egg yolks with cream cheese, baking powder and a pinch of salt.
instructions.name: In a bowl beat egg yolks with cream cheese, baking powder and a pinch of salt.

instructions.text: In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
instructions.name: In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.

instructions.text: Add egg yolks mixture to the beaten egg whites and mix gently until smooth.
instructions.name: Add egg yolks mixture to the beaten egg whites and mix gently until smooth.

instructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper or foil.
instructions.name: Line a baking tray with parchment paper or foil.

instructions.text: Spoon the batter onto baking tray to make 8 circular batters and bake 25-30 minutes or until lightly golden. Cool for several minutes.
instructions.name: Spoon the batter onto baking tray to make 8 circular batters and bake 25-30 minutes or until lightly golden. Cool for several minutes.

instructions.text: Spread half of baked cloud breads with mayo, top with sliced avocado, bacon slice, close the sandwich with another cloud bread and enjoy!
instructions.name: Spread half of baked cloud breads with mayo, top with sliced avocado, bacon slice, close the sandwich with another cloud bread and enjoy!

recipe.title: Keto BLT with cloud bread
recipe.description: Is there a more heavenly taste combo than bacon, lettuce and tomato? Just the mere mention of "BLT" and the clouds start to part! We paired this mouthwatering, keto version with fluffy cloud bread, also known as oopsie bread. Oops, it's bread! Gluten-free and grain-free, it's a heavenly low carb take on a classic sandwich. Indulge.
recipe.ingredients: 3 eggs, 4 oz. cream cheese, 1 pinch salt, 1/2 tbsp ground psyllium husk powder, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp cream of tartar (optional), 2 tbsp mayonnaise, 5 oz. bacon, 2 oz. lettuce, 1 tomato

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Separate the eggs, with egg whites in one bowl and egg yolks in another. Note, egg whites whip better in a metal or ceramic bowl as opposed to plastic.

Whip egg whites together with salt (and cream of tartar, if you are using any) until very stiff, preferably using a hand held electric mixer. You should be able to turn the bowl over without the egg whites moving.
In the bowl with the egg yokes, add the cream cheese, psyllium husk, and baking powder and mix well.
Gently fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture — try to keep the air in the egg whites.
Place two dollops of the mixture per serving on a paper-lined baking tray. Spread out the circles with a spatula to about ½ inch (1 cm) thick pieces.
Bake in the middle of the oven for about 25 minutes, until they turn golden.
Fry the bacon in a skillet on medium high heat until crispy.
Place the cloud bread pieces top-side down.
Spread mayonnaise on each bread.
Place lettuce, tomato and fried bacon in layers between the bread halves.

items.question: What Is Cloud Bread?
items.answer: Cloud bread, sometimes calls oopsie bread, is a gluten-free, low carb bread substitute made with eggs and cream cheese. It gets its name from its light, airy texture (like a cloud), and requires no flour. While this bread has become popular on TikTok in recent years, I've been making mine since 2016.
items.title: Cloud Bread (Easy Recipe) - Wholesome Yum

recipe.title: Cloud Bread (Easy Recipe)
recipe.description: This cloud bread recipe is light, fluffy, and a little buttery! It's naturally low carb, gluten-free, & easy to make with just 3 ingredients.
recipe.ingredients: 3 large Eggs ((at room temperature; whites and yolks separated)), 3 oz Mascarpone ((or cream cheese; softened)), 1/8 tsp Cream of tartar ((optional)), 1/8 tsp Sea salt

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (149 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease lightly.
instructions.name: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (149 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease lightly.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the egg whites and cream of tartar, until stiff peaks form. (Make sure they are stiff peaks, not soft peaks!)
instructions.name: In a large bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the egg whites and cream of tartar, until stiff peaks form. (Make sure they are stiff peaks, not soft peaks!)

instructions.text: In a second large bowl, use the mixer to beat the mascarpone,  egg yolks, and sea salt until smooth.
instructions.name: In a second large bowl, use the mixer to beat the mascarpone,  egg yolks, and sea salt until smooth.

instructions.text: Carefully and gradually fold the egg whites into the mascarpone mixture with a spatula. Use a folding motion to incorporate, being careful not to break down the air bubbles in the whites.
instructions.name: Carefully and gradually fold the egg whites into the mascarpone mixture with a spatula. Use a folding motion to incorporate, being careful not to break down the air bubbles in the whites.

instructions.text: Scoop the mixture into 6 circular discs onto the parchment paper.
instructions.name: Scoop the mixture into 6 circular discs onto the parchment paper.

instructions.text: Bake for 25-35 minutes, until golden.
instructions.name: Bake for 25-35 minutes, until golden.

instructions.text: Let the cloud bread cool a bit on the baking sheet, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before enjoying.
instructions.name: Let the cloud bread cool a bit on the baking sheet, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely before enjoying.

items.question: Why didn't my egg whites whip up?
items.answer: Egg whites are extremely sensitive to fat! If there are traces of egg yolks in the whites, or maybe some oil or fat in the bowl or on the whip attachment, then the egg whites will not whip up into stiff peaks. Make sure everything is super clean and clear of fats for the egg whites to get fluffy!

recipe.title: The Best Cloud Bread Recipe
recipe.description: The Best Cloud Bread Recipe: Low carb, keto, low fat, gluten-free, grain-free bread you can use for sandwiches on a low carb diet!
recipe.ingredients: 4  large eggs, (separated), 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar, 2 ounces low-fat cream cheese, 1 teaspoon Italian herb seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon sea salt, 1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. If you have a convection oven, set on convect. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper.
instructions.name: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. If you have a convection oven, set on convect. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper.

instructions.text: Separate the egg whites and egg yolks. Place the whites in a stand mixer with a whip attachment. Add the cream of tartar and beat on high until the froth turns into firm meringue peaks. Move to a separate bowl.
instructions.name: Separate the egg whites and egg yolks. Place the whites in a stand mixer with a whip attachment. Add the cream of tartar and beat on high until the froth turns into firm meringue peaks. Move to a separate bowl.

instructions.text: Place the cream cheese in the empty stand mixing bowl. Beat on high to soften. Then add the egg yolks one at a time to incorporate. Scrape the bowl and beat until the mixture is completely smooth. Then beat in the Italian seasoning, salt, and garlic powder.
instructions.name: Place the cream cheese in the empty stand mixing bowl. Beat on high to soften. Then add the egg yolks one at a time to incorporate. Scrape the bowl and beat until the mixture is completely smooth. Then beat in the Italian seasoning, salt, and garlic powder.

instructions.text: Gently fold the firm meringue into the yolk mixture. Try to deflate the meringue as little as possible, so the mixture is still firm and foamy. Spoon 1/4 cup portions of the foam onto the baking sheets and spread into even 4-inch circles, 3/4 inch high. Make sure to leave space around each circle.
instructions.name: Gently fold the firm meringue into the yolk mixture. Try to deflate the meringue as little as possible, so the mixture is still firm and foamy. Spoon 1/4 cup portions of the foam onto the baking sheets and spread into even 4-inch circles, 3/4 inch high. Make sure to leave space around each circle.

instructions.text: Bake on convect for 15-18 minutes, or in a conventional oven for up to 30 minutes. The bread should be golden on the outside and firm. The center should not jiggle when shaken. Cool for several minutes on the baking sheets, then move and serve!
instructions.name: Bake on convect for 15-18 minutes, or in a conventional oven for up to 30 minutes. The bread should be golden on the outside and firm. The center should not jiggle when shaken. Cool for several minutes on the baking sheets, then move and serve!

recipe.title: Cloud Bread
recipe.description: For a guilt-free sandwich option or you want to explore innovative recipes, Cloud Bread is a fantastic addition to your culinary repertoire
recipe.ingredients: 3  eggs, 2 tbsp cream cheese, low fat, ½ tsp baking powder

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
instructions.name: Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

instructions.text: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Place the egg whites in a clean mixing bowl and set aside.
instructions.name: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Place the egg whites in a clean mixing bowl and set aside.

instructions.text: In a separate bowl, combine the egg yolks, cream cheese, and baking powder. Mix well until smooth and no lumps of cream cheese remain.
instructions.name: In a separate bowl, combine the egg yolks, cream cheese, and baking powder. Mix well until smooth and no lumps of cream cheese remain.

instructions.text: Using an electric mixer or whisk, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. This may take a few minutes.
instructions.name: Using an electric mixer or whisk, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. This may take a few minutes.

instructions.text: Gently fold the egg yolk mixture into the beaten egg whites. Make sure to mix it gently to avoid deflating the egg whites.
instructions.name: Gently fold the egg yolk mixture into the beaten egg whites. Make sure to mix it gently to avoid deflating the egg whites.

instructions.text: Spoon the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming small rounds or desired shapes.
instructions.name: Spoon the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming small rounds or desired shapes.

instructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the Cloud Bread is golden brown and firm to the touch.
instructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the Cloud Bread is golden brown and firm to the touch.

instructions.text: Once done, remove from the oven and let the Cloud Bread cool on a wire rack.
instructions.name: Once done, remove from the oven and let the Cloud Bread cool on a wire rack.

instructions.text: Enjoy your homemade Cloud Bread as a low-carb bread alternative or use it as a base for sandwiches or other creative dishes.
instructions.name: Enjoy your homemade Cloud Bread as a low-carb bread alternative or use it as a base for sandwiches or other creative dishes.

recipe.title: Easy Cloud Bread
recipe.description: Eggs, cream cheese, and cream of tartar are baked together forming cloud bread, a gluten-free fluffy bread substitute.
recipe.ingredients: 3 large eggs, separated, 0.25 teaspoon cream of tartar, 2 ounces cream cheese, very soft, 1 tablespoon white sugar

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Beat egg whites and cream of tartar together in a bowl until stiff peaks form.

Mix egg yolks, cream cheese, and sugar together in a separate bowl using a wooden spoon and then mixing with a hand-held egg beater until mixture is very smooth and has no visible cream cheese. Gently fold egg whites into cream cheese mixture, taking care not to deflate the egg whites.
Carefully scoop mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming 5 to 6 "buns".
Bake in the preheated oven until cloud bread is lightly browned, about 30 minutes.

items.question: Is it difficult to make cloud bread?
items.answer:
It's not exactly difficult, but any recipe that requires separating eggs, whipping the egg whites, and carefully folding them into a batter is involved and requires patience.

This 90-second keto bread, for example, is easier. However, cloud bread is the best low-carb bread alternative, so the effort involved in making it is worth it, in my opinion.
items.title: Cloud Bread Recipe (Oopsie Bread) - Healthy Recipes Blog

meta_url.path: › home  › keto bread  › cloud bread (oopsie bread)

items.question: Does cloud bread taste like real bread?
items.answer:
No, it doesn't. But its texture is similar to spongy hamburger buns. So, even though it's not exactly bread, it does fill the need to serve a burger on a bun or to make a sandwich.

My main complaint is that this bread is on the delicate side and tears quite easily. This means that using it as a bun substitute for a burger is even messier than usual.
items.title: Cloud Bread Recipe (Oopsie Bread) - Healthy Recipes Blog

meta_url.path: › home  › keto bread  › cloud bread (oopsie bread)

items.question: Why is it called "cloud" or "oopsie" bread?
items.answer: The name "cloud bread" reflects its airy, fluffy texture. It's sometimes called "oopsie" bread because it was supposedly made by mistake. But what a fortunate mistake that was! It comes in handy when you want to make low-carb buns or rolls.

recipe.title: Cloud Bread Recipe (Oopsie Bread)
recipe.description: This fluffy cloud bread (also known as "oopsie bread" or "oopsie rolls") is made with just five ingredients and is the perfect keto bread.
recipe.ingredients: Nonstick cooking spray, 3  large eggs, 1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar, 1/4 cup Greek yogurt (plain, whole milk), 1/8 teaspoon sea salt

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 300°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper and lightly spray them with nonstick spray.
instructions.name: Preheat your oven to 300°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper and lightly spray them with nonstick spray.

instructions.text: Separate the eggs into two bowls: whites in a medium bowl and yolks in a large bowl.
instructions.name: Separate the eggs into two bowls: whites in a medium bowl and yolks in a large bowl.

instructions.text: Using an electric whisk, whip the egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff.
instructions.name: Using an electric whisk, whip the egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff.

instructions.text: Whisk the egg yolks, Greek yogurt, and salt until smooth.
instructions.name: Whisk the egg yolks, Greek yogurt, and salt until smooth.

instructions.text: Using a spatula, carefully fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture, working in batches. Work by placing a mound of egg whites on top of the yolk mixture, then gently fold the yolk mixture from under and over the egg whites. Fold again and again until incorporated.
instructions.name: Using a spatula, carefully fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture, working in batches. Work by placing a mound of egg whites on top of the yolk mixture, then gently fold the yolk mixture from under and over the egg whites. Fold again and again until incorporated.

instructions.text: Repeat with more egg white mounds until the entire mixture is fully incorporated.
instructions.name: Repeat with more egg white mounds until the entire mixture is fully incorporated.

instructions.text: Using a 1/4 cup ice cream scoop or measuring cup, spoon 5-6 large mounds of the mixture onto each of the prepared baking sheets.
instructions.name: Using a 1/4 cup ice cream scoop or measuring cup, spoon 5-6 large mounds of the mixture onto each of the prepared baking sheets.

instructions.text: Gently press each mound with a spatula to flatten it slightly.
instructions.name: Gently press each mound with a spatula to flatten it slightly.

instructions.text: Bake until golden brown and set, about 30 minutes. Cool the bread pieces on the cookie sheet for a few minutes, then gently transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. Alternatively, you can use them while still warm.
instructions.name: Bake until golden brown and set, about 30 minutes. Cool the bread pieces on the cookie sheet for a few minutes, then gently transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. Alternatively, you can use them while still warm.

recipe.title: Cloud Bread
recipe.description: Cloud Bread is an easy to make, light and fluffy bread substitute. These are low carb, under 40 calories each and the perfect way to lighten up a sandwich! Perfect for Weight Watchers and 21 Day Fix approved!
recipe.ingredients: 3  large eggs (divided), ⅛ teaspoon cream of tartar, 3 tablespoons cream cheese (or ⅓ cup fat free cream cheese, or light Greek yogurt)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F. Line a pan with parchment paper or a silpat mat.
instructions.name: Preheat oven to 300°F. Line a pan with parchment paper or a silpat mat.

instructions.text: Mix egg whites & cream of tartar on high speed until stiff peaks form.
instructions.name: Mix egg whites & cream of tartar on high speed until stiff peaks form.

instructions.text: In a large bowl mix egg yolks & greek yogurt (or cream cheese) until well combined and smooth. Gently fold in about 1 cup of the egg white mixture until well combined. Add remaining egg whites and fold just until mixed.
instructions.name: In a large bowl mix egg yolks & greek yogurt (or cream cheese) until well combined and smooth. Gently fold in about 1 cup of the egg white mixture until well combined. Add remaining egg whites and fold just until mixed.

instructions.text: Divide egg mixture into 6 equal portions on prepared pan. Spread until about ½″ thick.
instructions.name: Divide egg mixture into 6 equal portions on prepared pan. Spread until about ½″ thick.

instructions.text: Bake 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Immediately move to a wire rack and cool completely (at least 60 minutes).
instructions.name: Bake 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Immediately move to a wire rack and cool completely (at least 60 minutes).

instructions.text: Refrigerate in a sealed container to store.
instructions.name: Refrigerate in a sealed container to store.

recipe.title: Keto Cloud Bread
recipe.description: If you're following the ketogenic diet﻿, there's a good chance you're missing bread. We've got a super easy recipe﻿ for cloud bread that's light on carbs but heavy enough to stand up to sandwich fillings.
recipe.ingredients: 3 large eggs, at room temperature , 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar, Pinch of kosher salt, 2 oz. cream cheese, softened, 1 tbsp. Italian seasoning, 2 tbsp. shredded mozzarella or grated Parmesan, 2 tsp. tomato paste, 1/8 tsp. kosher salt, 1 tsp. poppy seeds, 1 tsp. sesame seeds, 1 tsp. minced dried garlic, 1 tsp. minced dried onion, 1 1/2 tsp. ranch seasoning powder

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300°and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

Separate egg whites from yolks into two medium glass bowls. Add cream of tartar and salt to egg whites, then using a hand mixer, beat until stiff peaks from, 2 to 3 minutes. Add cream cheese to egg yolks, then, using a hand mixer, mix yolks and cream cheese until combined. Gently fold egg yolk mixture into egg whites.
Divide mixture into 8 mounds on prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 4” apart. Bake until golden, 25 to 30 minutes.
Immediately sprinkle each piece of bread with cheese and bake until melty, 2 to 3 minutes more. Let cool slightly.

recipe.title: Cloud bread
recipe.description: Light and fluffy, this bread substitute lives up to its name. Use it as a low-carb option for sandwiches
recipe.ingredients: oil or butter for greasing, 4 eggs, separated, 50g cream cheese, ¼ tsp cream of tartar, ½ tsp nigella seeds

instructions.text: Heat oven to 150C/130C fan/gas 2 and line 2 large baking sheets with baking paper, then grease well with butter or oil.
In a large bowl and using electric beaters, whisk the egg whites together until stiff peaks form. You should be able to carefully turn the bowl upside down without it falling out.

In another bowl, put the egg yolks, cream cheese and cream of tartar then whisk together (no need to wash the beaters first) until smooth, pale and frothy. Next, fold the egg whites, a spoonful at a time into the yolk mixture, be as gentle as you can with this so you don’t knock out too much of the air and finally fold in the nigella seeds and season with salt and pepper.

Carefully dollop the mixture onto the prepared baking sheets, if the mixture is a little runny when you get to the bottom of the bowl don’t use the last few spoonfuls – only use the really fluffy mix on the top. Bake for 20 mins or until lightly golden and craggy on top. Allow to cool for a few moments before carefully removing from the paper with a palette knife.
